projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

div.p: AN ORDINANCE FOR Further Doubling upon AND Finishing the SALE OF Deans, Deans & Chapters LANDS, And of Mannors of Rectories, Gleablands, &c.
ORdered by his Highne≈øs the Lord Protector, and His Council, That this Ordinance be forthwith Printed and Publi≈øhed.

closer.signed: Henry Scobell, Clerk of the Council.

div.p: London, Printed by William du-Gard and Henry Hills, Printers to His Highne≈øs the Lord Protector, 1654.

div.head: seal of the Commonwealth AN ORDINANCE FOR Further doubling upon and fini≈øhing the ≈øale of Deans, Deans and Chapters Lands, and of Mannors of Rectories, Gleab-Lands, &c.
div.p:
Whereas by one Act of Parlament entituled, An Act for ≈øale of the Mannors of Rectories and Glebe-lands, late belonging to Arch Bi≈øhops, Bi≈øhops, Deans, Deans and Chapters, It is enacted and Declared, That all Mannors of Rectories, impropriate Me≈ø≈øuages,
Tenements, Gleab-lands, Pa≈øtures, Meadows, Mar≈øhes, belonging to any Rectorie impropriate, and Fee-farm Rents, i≈ø≈øuing out of Mannors or Rectories impropriate, jointly or ≈øeverally charged therewith late belonging or appertaining to any Rectorie impropriate, Par≈øonage, Church, Chappel, or Donative, late appertaining or belonging to any Arch-Bi≈øhop, Bi≈øhop, Dean, Dean and Chapter, Prebend or other per≈øon or per≈øons or bodies Politique, mentioned in one Ordinance of the ninth of December 1646. Entituled, An Ordinance of this pre≈øent Parlament for aboli≈øhing of Arch-Bi≈øhops and Bi≈øhops within the Common-wealth of England, and Dominion of Wales, and for ≈øettling their Lands and Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øions upon Tru≈øtees for the u≈øe of the Common-wealth. And in one Act of Parlament, Entituled, An Act of the Commons of England in Parlament a≈ø≈øembled for the aboli≈øhing of Deans, Deans and Chapters, Canons, Prebends, and other offices and titles of or belonging to any Cathedral or Collegiate Church or Chappel within England and Wales, to be aboli≈øhed in right of his or their ≈øaid Office or function, ≈øhould be and were ≈øettled in the full ≈øei≈øon and po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of the re≈øpective Tru≈øtees in the ≈øaid Ordinance and Act named, their Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns. And the ≈øaid re≈øpective Tru≈øtees in the ≈øaid Ordinance and Act named were authorized & required to contract, bargain, ≈øell, alien, and conveigh all and every the Premi≈ø≈øes, and to execute all powers and authorities in ≈øale thereof, as they might have done in the
≈øale of any Honors, Mannors, or Lands in the ≈øaid Ordinance and Act mentioned. And whereas likewi≈øe by one other Act, Entituled, An Additional Act, for the more ≈øpeedy effecting of the Sale of the Mannors of Rectories and Glebelands, late belonging to the Arch-Bi≈øhops, Bi≈øhops, Deans, Deans and Chapters, &c. and for the better incouragement of Lenders upon the ≈øecuritie thereof, and of other Lands and Hereditaments of the ≈øaid Deans and Chapters, The Parlament did enact and declare, that all and ≈øingular the Honors, Mannors, Lands, Tenements and Hereditaments, which by the ≈øaid Act for aboli≈øhing of Deans, Deans and Chapters, &c. were expo≈øed to ≈øale, and not contracted for before the five and twentieth day of October, One thou≈øand ≈øix hundred and fiftie, (other then ≈øuch as by the ≈øaid la≈øt recived Act were re≈øerved from ≈øale) ≈øhould bee and were thereby declared to bee part of the ≈øecuritie for the one hundred and twentie thou≈øand pounds, which by the ≈øaid forerecited Act was to bee borrowed, & ≈øhould extend to ≈øecure as well the debts, principal and intere≈øt, which ≈øhould bee doubled, as for the moneys which ≈øhould bee advanced and paid in to double the ≈øame, and the intere≈øt from the time of doubling until the payment. And that if the Mannors, Lands, Tenements, and hereditaments (by the ≈øaid Act for aboli≈øhing of Deans, Deans and Chapters, &c. expo≈øed to ≈øale) ≈øo contracted for before the five and twentieth day of October, One thou≈øand ≈øix hundred and fiftie, ≈øhould (according to the rates at which the ≈øame were contracted for) amount unto a greater value
than the moneys, debts and other charges, which before the ≈øecond day of October, One thou≈øand ≈øix hundred and fiftie, were charged upon the ≈øame, or to bee ≈øatisfied thereby, and it ≈øhould bee ≈øo declared by the Committee for ob≈øtructions; That in ≈øuch ca≈øe the overplus of the value of the premi≈ø≈øes ≈øo contracted for, ≈øhould al≈øo bee, and ≈øhould bee accounted as part of the ≈øecuritie for the ≈øaid moneys: And it was al≈øo Enacted and Ordeined, that the Tru≈øtees in whom the ≈øame premi≈ø≈øes ≈øo intended for ≈øecuritie were re≈øpectively ve≈øted, and their heirs re≈øpectively ≈øhould ≈øtand ≈øeized thereof, and of the Rents, i≈ø≈øues and profits thereof, until ≈øale; And of the moneys which ≈øhould bee rai≈øed by the ≈øale thereof, unto and for the u≈øes following, viz. for the payment of the moneys and debts which ≈øhould bee owing upon the ≈øecuritie of the ≈øaid premi≈ø≈øes, and all ≈øalaries and incident charges, and the remainder thereof to the u≈øe of the Common-Wealth, in ≈øuch manner as the Parlament ≈øhould appoint; And that all and every the ≈øaid Rents, i≈ø≈øues and profits of the premi≈ø≈øes, and moneys to bee rai≈øed by the ≈øale thereof, ≈øhould bee paid and i≈ø≈øued out to the purpo≈øes afore≈øaid, by the Trea≈øurers thereof, according to ≈øuch warrant as they ≈øhould receive from the Tru≈øtees for Deans, Deans and Chapters lands, or any five or more of them, in that behalf; And whereas by the ≈øaid la≈øt recited Act all and every the premi≈ø≈øes ≈øo appointed for ≈øecuritie as afore≈øaid, were appointed to bee ≈øold, and were ab≈øolutely di≈øpo≈øed unto the ≈øaid re≈øpective
Tru≈øtees for that purpo≈øe, as well for ≈øatisfying the moneys upon the ≈øaid Securitie, and for rai≈øing of moneys for the Service of the Common Wealth as al≈øo, to put a full end unto that bu≈øine≈øs, and the charge of Officers, and others employed therein.

And whereas neverthele≈øs, ≈øom part of the Premi≈ø≈øes yet remaineth un≈øold, there being ≈øo much already contracted for, as is ≈øufficient to ≈øatisfie all the Moneys due upon the former Securities: And whereas al≈øo former Contracts could not bee ≈øo exactly ≈øetled as to the preci≈øe ≈øummes, by differing Securities, re≈øpectively charged upon the Revenue of the ≈øaid Deans, Deans and Chapters, and other the Premi≈ø≈øes afore≈øaid, whereby ≈øom ≈øort of Debts, to which the ≈øaid Premi≈ø≈øes are lyable, are more then provided for to a con≈øiderable value, and the re≈øt not applicable to ≈øatisfie ≈øuch overplus which doth tend to the di≈øadvantage both of particular Per≈øons, and al≈øo of the Common-Wealth, by retarding the whole work. To the end therefore, a ≈øpeedy end may bee put to the ≈øaid Sale, and the Common-Wealth ea≈øed of the burthen and charge thereof;

Bee it Ordained by his highne≈øs the Lord Protector, by and with the con≈øent of his Council and it is Ordained by the Authority afore≈øaid. That over and above the ≈øumme of three hundred thou≈øand pounds, appointed to bee borrowed upon the Securitie held forth by the fir≈øt recited Act, and over and above the ≈øumme of one hundred and twenty thou≈øand pounds more, borrowed upon the Securitie held forth in the two
la≈øt recited Acts, or either of them, the ≈øumme of twenty thou≈øand pounds ≈øhall bee further borrowed upon the Securitie of ≈øuch of the Premi≈ø≈øes re≈øpectively, expo≈øed to ≈øale by the ≈øaid Acts, or either of them, in ≈øuch ≈øort as is hereafter expre≈ø≈øed, by way of doubling the like ≈øumme, as ≈øhall bee due to any per≈øon or per≈øons, Body politick or Corporate, for any Money, Plate, Norl, Arms, or other thing advanced upon the Publick Faith, or which hath been at any time allowed by any Act or Ordinance of Parlament, to bee doubled, as Publick Faith; together with Intere≈øt upon ≈øuch Publick Faith Debts, after the rate of eight pounds in the hundred, by the year, untill the ≈øtating of ≈øuch Debts and Intere≈øt, by the Per≈øons named and appointed in and by an Act of Parlament, Entituled, An Additional Act for ≈øale of ≈øeveral Lands and E≈øtates forfeited to the Commonwealth for Trea≈øon, to bee Regi≈øter Accomptant or any of them which the ≈øaid Per≈øons, or any of them, are hereby authorized to ≈øtate accordingly. And after the ≈øtating of ≈øuch Debts and Intere≈øt, and doubling thereof, the re≈øpective Creditors to bee allowed onely ≈øix pounds in the hundred by the year, for the whole of ≈øuch doubled Publick Faith Debts, untill the payment thereof, or defalcation upon purcha≈øe, In relation to which doubling intended by this Ordinance, the Tru≈øtees, Trea≈øurers, Regi≈øter and Accomptant, and all other officers concerned therein, are hereby authorized and required to proceed according to the directions of the Acts of Parlament in like ca≈øe made and provided, ≈øave onely as to what is hereby
altered, re≈øtrictive to the debts, and to allowance of intere≈øt as afore≈øaid, and all and every per≈øon and per≈øons, bodie politick and corporate, to whom any debts capable of doubling within this pre≈øent Ordinance, ≈øhall bee due, and his and their re≈øpective a≈ø≈øigns, and all per≈øons doubling ≈øuch debts and their re≈øpective a≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall have all and the like liberties, privileges, benefits, and advantages re≈øpectively in reference to the premi≈ø≈øes, as any ≈øuch per≈øon or per≈øons, bodies politick or corporate, their or any of their a≈ø≈øigns might or ought to have had by the afore≈øaid recited Acts or either of them, ≈øave onely what is hereby altered with re≈øtriction to debts and intere≈øts as afore≈øaid, and all and every per≈øon and per≈øons who ≈øhall have their debts and intere≈øts ≈øtated as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall pay into the Trea≈øurers named in the ≈øaid Act for ≈øale of the ≈øaid Mannors of Rectories, or one of them, the money wherewith he or they ought to double within ten dayes next after Certificate thereof to the Trea≈øurers, or otherwi≈øe ≈øhall lo≈øe his or their Publick Faith debts, unle≈øs hee or they ≈øhall ≈øhew good cau≈øe to the Trea≈øurers or any one of them for his or their faller therein. And bee it further Ordeined, that both the Certificates or Receipts to bee given by the ≈øaid Trea≈øurers, or one of them, for moneys to bee doubled upon the ≈øecuritie held forth by this pre≈øent Ordinance, as al≈øo all Certificates, Receipts, or Bills for moneys or debts doubled or tran≈øferred upon the ≈øecurities held forth by any the Acts afore≈øaid, which were defalke able in
payment for any purcha≈øe made within the ≈øame former Acts or any of them ≈øhall be and are herby made to be defalkeable in payment in manner and form following; That is to ≈øay, the Certificates or Receipts for moneys to bee doubled upon the ≈øecuritie held forth by this pre≈øent Ordinance, ≈øhall bee defalkeable in payment for both moities of the purcha≈øe moneys, payable for any part of the premi≈ø≈øes which yet remain uncontracted for, and in payment for all ≈øecond moities payable upon contracts made of any the ≈øaid premi≈ø≈øes, at any time before the pa≈ø≈øing of this Ordinance; And the Certificates, Receipts or Bils for moneys doubled, or transferred upon the ≈øecurities held forth by any the ≈øaid Acts, ≈øhall bee equally and alike defalkeable for any or both moities of the purcha≈øe money, payable for any the premi≈ø≈øes expo≈øed to ≈øale by any the former Acts either contracted or uncontracted for: And the Trea≈øurers and all other officers concerned therein, are hereby authorized and required to admit and allow thereof accordingly; Provided that all defalkations to bee made by virtue of this Ordinance, for moneys due upon any the Certificates, Receipts, or Bills afore≈øaid, ≈øhall bee of one di≈øtinct accompt, as to the whole, or any moitie of the purcha≈øe money for which they ≈øhall bee ≈øo defalked; Provided al≈øo that where any purcha≈øer or purcha≈øers, his or their A≈ø≈øign or A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall tender any Bills or Receipts by this Ordinance made applicable for payment of any ≈øecond Moity, other then ≈øuch
Bills or Receipts, as by his or their Contract ought to have been applied thereunto; the party or parties ≈øo tendring ≈øuch Bills or Receipts, ≈øhall defalk ≈øo much more in value, as ≈øhall countervail the Intere≈øt incurred by his or their elap≈øed time. For which ≈øecond Moities, as al≈øo for defalcations as afore≈øaid, the ≈øaid Trea≈øurers, or one of them, are hereby authorized to give ≈øuch Purcha≈øer his or their Receipt or Acquittance and re-Conveyance accordingly. And bee it further Ordained and declared by the Authoritie afore≈øaid, That where any pre≈øent E≈øtate of, or in any the Lands or po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øions of the late Arch Bi≈øhops, Bi≈øhops, Deans, Deans and Chapters, Cannons; Prevends, and other the per≈øons afore≈øaid, ≈øhall bee doubtfully returned upon any Survey, either as to the Certain being or Legality of any Lea≈ø, or Copy of Court Roll. or any Life or Lives upon any Lea≈ø or Copy of Court Roll; the Temant or Tennants claiming ≈øuch Lea≈ø, Copy or E≈øtate, ≈øhall (as to the Lands already Surveyed) before the fir≈øt day of July, one thou≈øand ≈øix hundred fiftie and four; and as to the Lands un≈øurveyed, within three moneths next after the re≈øpective Returns of the Surveys thereof to the re≈øpective Regi≈øters for ≈øale of the premi≈ø≈øes, make proof of his or their E≈øtate or E≈øtates before the Commi≈ø≈øioners for removing of Ob≈øtructions, and procure their Order for Allowance thereof, or otherwi≈øe ≈øhall bee for ever barred and excluded from any benefit or advantage thereby. Provided neverthele≈øs, That the Power given by the former Acts to the Surveyor
General, as al≈øo the Power given by Ordinance of Parlament to the Contractors for ≈øale of Bi≈øhops Lands, for allowance of any e≈øtates made good by proof before them re≈øpectively, within forty days next after the return of the Survey of any of the premi≈ø≈øes, bee not any wayes impeached. And provided al≈øo, that the power given or transferred to the Commi≈ø≈øioners for removing of Ob≈øtructions, by any Ordinance or act of Parlament for allowance of E≈øtates, bee not any wayes hereby enlarged.

And bee it further Ordained, That any two Surveyors Commi≈ø≈øionated by the re≈øpective Tru≈øtees for ≈øale of the Premi≈ø≈øes, ≈øhall have like power to all intents and purpo≈øes as is given to any three or more Surveyors, ≈øo Commi≈ø≈øionated by the Ordinance for ≈øale of Bi≈øhops Lands, And that for the perfecting of any Surveys already returned or which ≈øhall bee returned imperfect, where the Charge of a re-≈øurvey (in regard of the ≈ømall value of the Lands remotene≈øs of their ≈øituation, or otherwi≈øe) may bee conceived too great for the Common wealth to bear: it ≈øhall bee in every ≈øuch ca≈øe in the power of William Webb E≈øquire, Surveyor General, to inform him≈øelf by the be≈øt means and wayes hee can, touching the premi≈ø≈øes, either by oath, or otherwi≈øe, (which Oath hee is hereby authorized to admini≈øter) and upon ≈øuch Information had, and by him communicated to the re≈øpective Contractors, or any three or more of them, hee ≈øhall and may by and with their advice, amend and perfect any ≈øuch Survey accordingly.

And bee it further Ordained by the Authority afore≈øaid, That in ca≈øe any per≈øon or per≈øons
who hold in his or their po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion or tenure, any of the lands, tenements and hereditaments of the late Arch-Bi≈øhops, Bi≈øhops, Deans, Deans and Chapters, Cannons, Prevends, &c. which by this pre≈øent Ordinance, or any Ordinance or former Act of Parlament, are expo≈øed to ≈øale, and yet undi≈øcovered, and which are or ought to bee in the pre≈øent po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of the re≈øpective Tru≈øtees for the u≈øe of the Commonwealth, ≈øhall make the fir≈øt di≈øcoverie thereof to the Surveyor General, before named; every ≈øuch per≈øon or per≈øons de≈øiring the ≈øame, ≈øhall bee admitted the preemption of all ≈øuch lands, rents, duties, and payments, by him or them di≈øcovered, at the lowe≈øt rates the re≈øpective Contractors are enabled to ≈øell the ≈øame for, by any Act or Ordinance of Parlament in that behalf; And where any per≈øon or per≈øons po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed of any the lands or premi≈ø≈øes, afore≈øaid, yet undi≈øcovered, by virtue of any Lea≈ø or Copie of Court-roll, dated before the fir≈øt of December, One thou≈øand ≈øix hundred fourty one, granted by any who had power to make or grant the ≈øame, ≈øhall before the ≈øaid fir≈øt day of July, bring or ≈øend in a true Copie of his or their Lea≈ø or Lea≈øes, Copie or Copies of Court-roll, to the ≈øaid Surveyor general, that a Survey may bee had of the premi≈ø≈øes, every ≈øuch per≈øon coming in within thirtie days next after the Return of any ≈øuch ≈øurvey, ≈øhall bee admitted to the preemption of the rever≈øion of his Lea≈ø or Copie, with the pre≈øent Rent incident thereunto at the lowe≈øt rates, the re≈øpective contractors are enabled
to ≈øell, as afore≈øaid. And in ca≈øe of his or their neglect to bring or ≈øend in ≈øuch true copie or copies, before the ≈øaid fir≈øt day of July, all and every ≈øuch per≈øon and per≈øons, ≈øhall forfeit and lo≈øe his or their pre≈øent e≈øtate, by Lea≈ø or Copie; and any per≈øon or per≈øons, who afterwards ≈øhall di≈øcover the ≈øame, ≈øhall have, and bee admitted to the preemption of the pre≈øent po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of ≈øuch Lands, and have the ≈øame conveyed to him or them, or to whom≈øoever hee or they ≈øhall nominate, and to his or their heirs and a≈ø≈øigns, at the like lowe≈øt rates the Contractors are enabled to ≈øell as afore≈øaid, any clau≈ø in this Ordinance, or any former Act or Ordinance of Parlament to the contrarie notwith≈øtanding.

And bee it further Ordeined by the Authoritie afore≈øaid, That Sir William Roberts Knight, John Blackwell the Elder, James Ru≈ø≈øell, Timothy Midleton, Robert Fenwicke, Thomas Aires, and Edward Cre≈ø≈øet, E≈øquires, Contractors named (with others) in an Ordinance of the Lords and Commons a≈ø≈øembled in Parlament, of the ≈øixteenth of November, One thou≈øand ≈øix hundred fortie ≈øix, appointing the ≈øale of the Lands and Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øions of the late Arch-bi≈øhops, and Bi≈øhops, for the u≈øe of the Common-Wealth, or any three or more of them, bee, and are hereby authorized, to do, u≈øe, exerci≈øe, perform, and execute all and every the Act and Acts, Authorities, Powers, and things relating a≈øwell to the ≈øale of the ≈øaid Lands and po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øions, as to the ≈øale of the Mannors of Rectories, and Glebe Lands &c.
lately belonging to the ≈øaid Arch-bi≈øhops, and Bi≈øhops, which any ≈øix or more of the Contractors named in the ≈øaid Ordinance, by virtue thereof, or any five or more of them by virtue of the former recited Act for ≈øale of the Mannors of Rectories, or by virtue of any additional Ordinances or Acts of Parlament concerning the ≈øale of the premi≈ø≈øes re≈øpectively, may, might, or ought to have don, u≈øed, exerci≈øed, performed, or executed, to all Intents, Con≈øtructions, and purpo≈øes.

And it is al≈øo further Ordeined, That the re≈øpective Tru≈øtees, Contractors, Trea≈øurers, Regi≈øter, Accomptant, Surveyor General, and all other Officers attending the Sale of the Premi≈ø≈øes, and every of them bee hereby authorized and required in all things relating to the putting of this Ordinance in execution (other than ≈øuch as are hereby altered or otherwi≈øe directed, to pur≈øue the directions of the former Acts and Ordinances re≈øpectively concerning the ≈øame. And for the more proper i≈ø≈øuing out of the Rents, I≈ø≈øues, and profits of the premi≈ø≈øes, together with the moneys ari≈øeing by the Sale thereof, It is further Ordeined by the Authoritie afore≈øaid, That the Tru≈øtees for Sale of Bi≈øhops Lands, ≈øhall have power, and are hereby impowred, to make warrants to the Trea≈øurers for the Sale of the Mannors of Rectories, Glebs &c. or one of them, for the payment of ≈øuch incident charges as have or ≈øhall ari≈øe upon the Sale of the Mannors of Rectories, Glebes &c. belonging to the late
Arch-bi≈øhops, and Bi≈øhops, onely; And the ≈øaid Trea≈øurers are hereby required to pay and di≈øcharge the ≈øaid warrants from time to time accordingly, Any thing in any former Act to the Contrary hereof notwith≈øtanding; and al≈øo that the Trea≈øurers appointed by this Ordinance to Receiv ≈øuch moneys as ≈øhall bee doubled hereon, ≈øhall not i≈ø≈øue forth any part of the Twentie thou≈øand pounds hereby appointed to bee doubled, but by, and in ≈øuch manner, as his highne≈øs with the advice and con≈øent of the Council ≈øhall direct.

Provided that this Ordinance nor any thing therin conteined, ≈øhal not extend to impower the re≈øpective Trea≈øurers to grant any further or greater allowance to any per≈øons imployed, or to bee imployed in the perfecting of this work, then what hath been heretofore allowed unto them, or any of them, or to others in their places re≈øpectively.

And bee it moreover Ordeined by the Authority afore≈øaid, That James No√™l ≈øhall bee Trea≈øurer in the Room of Alderman Thomas Noƒìl late decea≈øed, in relation to all moneys heretofore doubled at Weavers-Hall, upon the ≈øecuritie of Bi≈øhops Lands &c. who is hereby impowred and required to execute & perform all and every ≈øuch powers and authorities and duties, relateing to the di≈øcharge of his place, as the ≈øaid Thomas Noƒìl by virtue of any former Ordinance or Act of Parlament might have don.
ORdered by His Highne≈øs the Lord PROTECTOR and his Council, That this Ordinance bee forthwith Printed and publi≈øhed.

closer.signed: Hen. Scobell, Clerk of the Council.
